original: kaṭhopaniṣat
analyzed: kaṭhopaniṣad
translated: Katha Upanishad

original: uśan ha vai vājaśravasaḥ sarvavedasaṃ dadau /
analyzed: uśan ha vai vājaśravasaḥ sarvavedasam dadau
translated: Ushanas, the son of Shukra, gave away all his possessions.

original: tasya ha naciketā nāma putra āsa // / //
analyzed: tasya ha naciketāḥ nāma putraḥ āsa
translated: He had a son named Nachiketa.

original: taṃ ha kumāraṃ santaṃ dakṣiṇāsu nīyamānāsu śraddhāviveśa /
analyzed: tam ha kumāram santam dakṣiṇāsu nīyamānāsu śraddhā āviveśa
translated: When the sacrificial gifts were being taken away, faith entered the young boy.

original: so 'manyata // / //
analyzed: saḥ manyata
translated: He thought:

original: pītodakā jagdhatṛṇā dugdhadohā nirindriyāḥ /
analyzed: pīta udakāḥ jagdha tṛṇāḥ dugdha dohāḥ nirindriyāḥ
translated: Those whose water is drunk, whose grass is eaten, whose milk is drunk, and who are without senses,

original: anandā nāma te lokās tān sa gacchati tā dadat // / //
analyzed: anandāḥ nāma te lokāḥ tān sa gacchati tā dadat
translated: those worlds are called 'without joy'; he who gives them goes to those.

original: sa hovāca pitaraṃ tata kasmai māṃ dāsyasīti /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca pitaram tata kasmai mām dāsyasi iti
translated: He said to his father: To whom will you give me?

original: dvitīyaṃ tṛtīyam /
analyzed: dvitīyam tṛtīyam
translated: A second time, a third time.

original: taṃ hovāca mṛtyave tvā dadāmīti // / //
analyzed: tam ha uvāca mṛtyave tvā dadāmi iti
translated: He said to him: I will give you to Death.

original: bahūnām emi prathamo bahūnām emi madhyamaḥ /
analyzed: bahūnām emi prathamaḥ bahūnām emi madhyamaḥ
translated: I go as the first of many, I go as the middle of many.

original: kiṃ svid yamasya kartavyaṃ yan mayādya kariṣyati // / //
analyzed: kim svid yamasya kartavyam yat mayā adya kariṣyati
translated: What is the duty of Yama that he will do today for me?

original: anupaśya yathā pūrve pratipaśya tathāpare /
analyzed: anupaśya yathā pūrve pratipaśya tathā apare
translated: Look how the former were, and look how the later will be.

original: sasyam iva martyaḥ pacyate sasyam ivājāyate punaḥ // / //
analyzed: sasyam iva martyaḥ pacyate sasyam iva ājāyate punar
translated: A mortal is cooked like a crop, and is born again like a crop.

original: vaiśvānaraḥ praviśati atithir brāhmaṇo gṛhān /
analyzed: vaiśvānaraḥ praviśati atithiḥ brāhmaṇaḥ gṛhān
translated: Vaisvanara enters the house as a guest, a Brahmin.

original: tasyaitāṃ śāntiṃ kurvanti hara vaivasvatodakam // / //
analyzed: tasya etām śāntim kurvanti hara vaivasvata udakam
translated: They perform this peace offering for him: 'O Yama, take away the water of Vaivasvata.'

original: āśāpratīkṣe saṃgataṃ sūnṛtāṃ ca iṣṭāpūrte putrapaśūṃś ca sarvān /
analyzed: āśā pratīkṣe saṃgatam sūnṛtām ca iṣṭāpūrte putra paśūn ca sarvān
translated: Hope and expectation, truth and pleasantness, sacrifices and good works, and all the children and cattle,

original: etad vṛṅkte puruṣasyālpamedhaso yasyānaśnan vasati brāhmaṇo gṛhe // / //
analyzed: etat vṛṅkte puruṣasya alpamedhasaḥ yasya an aśnan vasati brāhmaṇaḥ gṛhe
translated: All this does he lose, the man of little understanding, in whose house a Brahmana lives, not eating.

original: tisro rātrīr yad avatsīr gṛhe me anaśnan brahmann atithir namasyaḥ /
analyzed: tisraḥ rātrīḥ yat gṛhe me an aśnan brahman atithiḥ namasyaḥ
translated: Three nights thou hast dwelt in my house, not eating, O Brahmana, a guest to be honoured.

original: namas te 'stu brahman svasti me 'stu tasmāt prati trīn varān vṛṇīṣva // / //
analyzed: namaḥ te stu brahman svasti me stu tasmāt prati trīn varān vṛṇīṣva
translated: To thee, O Brahmana, be homage! To me be welfare! Therefore choose thou three boons from me.

original: śāntasaṅkalpaḥ sumanā yathā syād vītamanyur gautamo mābhi mṛtyo /
analyzed: śānta saṅkalpaḥ su manāḥ yathā syāt vīta manyuḥ gautamaḥ mā abhi mṛtyo
translated: Be thou, O Death, of tranquil purpose, well-disposed, free from anger, O Gautama.

original: tvatprasṛṣṭaṃ mābhivadet pratīta etat trayāṇāṃ prathamaṃ varaṃ vṛṇe // / //
analyzed: tvad prasṛṣṭam mā abhivadet pratītaḥ etat trayāṇām prathamam varam vṛṇe
translated: Let not Uddalaki, when sent by me, speak of thee as one who has met with misfortune. This is the first of the three boons I choose.

original: yathā purastād bhavitā pratīta auddālakir āruṇir matprasṛṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: yathā purastāt bhavitā pratīta auddālakiḥ āruṇiḥ mad prasṛṣṭaḥ
translated: As thou hast been in the past, so shalt thou be in the future, O Uddalaki, the son of Aruna, sent by me.

original: sukhaṃ rātrīḥ śayitā vītamanyus tvāṃ dadṛśivān mṛtyumukhāt pramuktam // / //
analyzed: sukham rātrīḥ śayitā vīta manyuḥ tvām dadṛśivān mṛtyu mukhāt pramuktam
translated: Having slept happily the nights, free from anger, ye shall behold him delivered from the jaws of death.

original: svarge loke na bhayaṃ kiṃcanāsti na tatra tvaṃ na jarayā bibheti /
analyzed: svarge loke na bhayam kiṃcana asti na tatra tvam na jarayā bibheti
translated: In the world of heaven there is no fear whatever. There thou shalt not fear old age.

original: ubhe tīrtvā aśanāyāpipāse śokātigo modate svargaloke // / //
analyzed: ubhe tīrtvā aśanāyā pipāse śoka atigaḥ modate svarga loke
translated: Having passed over both hunger and thirst, free from grief, he rejoices in the world of heaven.

original: sa tvam agniṃ svargyam adhyeṣi mṛtyo prabrūhi taṃ śraddadhānāya mahyam /
analyzed: sa tvam agnim svargyam adhyeṣi mṛtyo prabrūhi tam śraddadhānāya mahyam
translated: You, O Death, are asking about the heavenly fire. Tell it to me who have faith in it.

original: svargalokā amṛtatvaṃ bhajanta etad dvitīyena vṛṇe vareṇa // / //
analyzed: svarga lokāḥ amṛta tvam bhajante etat dvitīyena vṛṇe vareṇa
translated: By this, the people attain the heavenly world and immortality. I choose this as my second boon.

original: pra te bravīmi tad u me nibodha svargyam agniṃ naciketaḥ prajānan /
analyzed: pra te bravīmi tat u me nibodha svargyam agnim naciketaḥ prajānan
translated: I tell you that, O Nachiketa, understand it well, knowing the heavenly fire.

original: anantalokāptim atho pratiṣṭhāṃ viddhi tvam etaṃ nihitaṃ guhāyām // / //
analyzed: ananta loka āptim atha u pratiṣṭhām viddhi tvam etam nihitam guhāyām
translated: Know this to be the attainment of endless worlds and the foundation, hidden in the cave.

original: lokādim agniṃ tam uvāca tasmai yā iṣṭakā yāvatīr vā yathā vā /
analyzed: loka ādim agnim tam uvāca tasmai yāḥ iṣṭakāḥ yāvatīḥ vā yathā vā
translated: He told him that fire which is the beginning of the worlds, the bricks, their number, and the manner (in which they are to be laid down).

original: sa cāpi tat pratyavadad yathoktam athāsya mṛtyuḥ punar āha tuṣṭaḥ // / //
analyzed: sa ca api tat pratyavadat yathā uktam atha asya mṛtyuḥ punar āha tuṣṭaḥ
translated: And he also repeated it as it was said. Then Death, being pleased, again said to him:

original: tam abravīt prīyamāṇo mahātmā varaṃ tavehādya dadāmi bhūyaḥ /
analyzed: tam abravīt prīyamāṇaḥ mahātmā varam tava iha adya dadāmi bhūyas
translated: The great one, being pleased, said to him, I shall again give you a boon here.

original: tavaiva nāmnā bhavitāyam agniḥ sṛṅkāṃ cemām anekarūpāṃ gṛhāṇa // / //
analyzed: tava eva nāmnā bhavitā ayam agniḥ sṛṅkām ca imām aneka rūpām gṛhāṇa
translated: This fire will be known by your name. And accept this Sṛṅkā (a kind of musical instrument) of many forms.

original: triṇāciketas tribhir etya sandhiṃ trikarmakṛt tarati janmamṛtyū /
analyzed: triṇāciketaḥ tribhiḥ etya sandhim tri karma kṛt tarati janma mṛtyū
translated: The Triṇāciketa, having come to the three junctions with the three (Vedas), the performer of the three acts, crosses birth and death.

original: brahmajajñaṃ devam īḍyaṃ viditvā nicāyyemāṃ śāntim atyantam eti // / //
analyzed: devam īḍyam viditvā nicāyya imām śāntim atyantam eti
translated: Having known the god born of Brahman, to be worshipped, having reflected, he goes to the highest peace.

original: triṇāciketas trayam etad viditvā ya evaṃ vidvāṃś cinute nāciketam /
analyzed: triṇāciketaḥ trayam etat viditvā yaḥ evam vidvān cinute nāciketam
translated: Tri-Nāciketa, having known these three, he who, knowing thus, piles the Nāciketa fire,

original: sa mṛtyupāśān purataḥ praṇodya śokātigo modate svargaloke // / //
analyzed: sa mṛtyu pāśān puratas praṇodya śoka atigaḥ modate svarga loke
translated: having removed the bonds of death in front, goes beyond grief and rejoices in the heavenly world.

original: eṣa te 'gnir naciketaḥ svargyo yam avṛṇīthā dvitīyena vareṇa /
analyzed: eṣa te gniḥ naciketaḥ svargyaḥ yam avṛṇīthāḥ dvitīyena vareṇa
translated: This is your heavenly fire, O Naciketas, which you have chosen with the second boon.

original: etam agniṃ tavaiva pravakṣyanti janāsas tṛtīyaṃ varaṃ naciketo vṛṇīṣva // / //
analyzed: etam agnim tava eva pravakṣyanti janāsaḥ tṛtīyam varam naciketaḥ vṛṇīṣva
translated: People will speak of this fire as yours. Choose a third boon, O Naciketas.

original: yeyaṃ prete vicikitsā manuṣye astīty eke nāyam astīti caike /
analyzed: yā iyam prete vicikitsā manuṣye asti iti eke na ayam asti iti ca eke
translated: This doubt about the dead, whether he exists or not, some say he exists, others say he does not.

original: etad vidyām anuśiṣṭas tvayāhaṃ varāṇām eṣa varas tṛtīyaḥ // / //
analyzed: etat vidyām anuśiṣṭaḥ tvayā aham varāṇām eṣa varaḥ tṛtīyaḥ
translated: Instructed by you, I know this knowledge. This is the third boon of the boons.

original: devair atrāpi vicikitsitaṃ purā na hi sujñeyam aṇur eṣa dharmaḥ /
analyzed: devaiḥ atrā api vicikitsitam purā na hi su jñeyam aṇuḥ eṣa dharmaḥ
translated: Even the gods doubted about this in the past, for this subtle truth is not easy to know.

original: anyaṃ varaṃ naciketo vṛṇīṣva mā moparotsīr ati mā sṛjainam // / //
analyzed: anyam varam naciketaḥ vṛṇīṣva mā mā uparotsīḥ ati mā sṛja enam
translated: Choose another boon, O Naciketas, do not tempt me, do not create this for me.

original: devair atrāpi vicikitsitaṃ kila tvaṃ ca mṛtyo yan na sujñeyam āttha /
analyzed: devaiḥ atrā api vicikitsitam kila tvam ca mṛtyo yat na su jñeyam āttha
translated: Even the gods doubted about this, it seems, O Death, and you say it is not easy to know.

original: vaktā cāsya tvādṛg anyo na labhyo nānyo varas tulya etasya kaścit // / //
analyzed: vaktā ca asya tvādṛś anyaḥ na labhyaḥ na anyaḥ varaḥ tulyaḥ etasya kaścid
translated: And another speaker like you cannot be found, and no other boon is equal to this in any way.

original: śatāyuṣaḥ putrapautrān vṛṇīṣva bahūn paśūn hastihiraṇyam aśvān /
analyzed: śata āyuṣaḥ putra pautrān vṛṇīṣva bahūn paśūn hasti hiraṇyam aśvān
translated: Choose many sons and grandsons with a life span of a hundred years, and many cattle, elephants, gold, and horses.

original: bhūmer mahad āyatanaṃ vṛṇīṣva svayaṃ ca jīva śarado yāvad icchasi // / //
analyzed: bhūmeḥ mahat āyatanam vṛṇīṣva svayam ca jīva śaradaḥ yāvat icchasi
translated: Choose a great abode on the earth, and live yourself as long as you wish.

original: etat tulyaṃ yadi manyase varaṃ vṛṇīṣva vittaṃ cirajīvikāṃ ca /
analyzed: etat tulyam yadi manyase varam vṛṇīṣva vittam cira jīvikām ca
translated: If you consider this equal to a boon, choose wealth and long life.

original: mahābhūmau naciketas tvam edhi kāmānāṃ tvā kāmabhājaṃ karomi // / //
analyzed: mahā bhūmau naciketaḥ tvam edhi kāmānām tvā kāma bhājam karomi
translated: O Naciketas, be prosperous on the great earth. I shall make you enjoy all your desires.

original: ye ye kāmā durlabhā martyaloke sarvān kāmāṃś chandataḥ prārthayasva /
analyzed: ye ye kāmāḥ durlabhāḥ martya loke sarvān kāmān chandataḥ prārthayasva
translated: Whatever desires are difficult to obtain in the world of mortals, desire all those desires as you wish.

original: imā rāmāḥ sarathāḥ satūryā na hīdṛśā lambhanīyā manuṣyaiḥ /
analyzed: imāḥ rāmāḥ sa rathāḥ sa tūryāḥ na hi īdṛśāḥ lambhanīyāḥ manuṣyaiḥ
translated: These beautiful women with their chariots and trumpets, which cannot be obtained by men,

original: ābhir matprattābhiḥ paricārayasva naciketo maraṇaṃ mānuprākṣīḥ // / //
analyzed: ābhiḥ mad prattābhiḥ paricārayasva naciketaḥ maraṇam mā anuprākṣīḥ
translated: serve them, O Naciketas, given by me, and do not ask for death.

original: śvobhāvā martyasya yad antakaitat sarvendriyāṇāṃ jarayanti tejaḥ /
analyzed: śvobhāvāḥ martyasya yat antaka etat sarva indriyāṇām jarayanti tejaḥ
translated: That which is the end of mortal life, the destruction of all, diminishes the vigor of all the senses.

original: api sarvaṃ jīvitam alpam eva tavaiva vāhās tava nṛtyagīte // / //
analyzed: api sarvam jīvitam alpam eva tava eva vāhāḥ tava nṛtya gīte
translated: Even the whole of life is short. Let these be yours, your vehicles, your dancing and singing.

original: na vittena tarpaṇīyo manuṣyo lapsyāmahe vittam adrākṣma cet tvā /
analyzed: na vittena tarpaṇīyaḥ manuṣyaḥ lapsyāmahe vittam adrākṣma ced tvā
translated: A man cannot be satisfied with wealth. If we could obtain and see you, we would obtain wealth.

original: jīviṣyāmo yāvad īśiṣyasi tvaṃ varas tu me varaṇīyaḥ sa eva // / //
analyzed: jīviṣyāmaḥ yāvat īśiṣyasi tvam varaḥ tu me varaṇīyaḥ saḥ eva
translated: We shall live as long as thou wilt live. But that very boon is to be chosen by me.

original: ajīryatām amṛtānām upetya jīryan martyaḥ kvadhaḥsthaḥ prajānan /
analyzed: ajīryatām amṛtānām upetya jīryan martyaḥ ku adhaḥsthaḥ prajānan
translated: Having approached the undecaying, immortal ones, the mortal man, who decays, who is placed low, who knows,

original: abhidhyāyan varṇaratipramodān atidīrghe jīvite ko rameta // / //
analyzed: abhidhyāyan varṇa rati pramodān ati dīrghe jīvite kaḥ rameta
translated: Meditating on the enjoyments of beauty, love, and pleasure, who would delight in a very long life?

original: yasminn idaṃ vicikitsanti mṛtyo yat sāmparāye mahati brūhi nas tat /
analyzed: yasmin idam vicikitsanti mṛtyo yat sāmparāye mahati brūhi naḥ tat
translated: In regard to which, O Death, they doubt, in the great matter of the next world, tell us that.

original: yo 'yaṃ varo gūḍham anupraviṣṭo nānyaṃ tasmān naciketā vṛṇīte // / //
analyzed: yaḥ yam varaḥ gūḍham anupraviṣṭaḥ na anyam tasmāt naciketāḥ vṛṇīte
translated: This boon which has entered into concealment, Nārada does not choose any other than that, O Naciketas.

original: iti prathamā vallī //
analyzed: iti prathamā vallī
translated: Thus ends the first Valli.

original: anyac chreyo 'nyad utaiva preyas te ubhe nānārthe puruṣaṃ sinītaḥ /
analyzed: anyat śreyaḥ nyat uta eva preyaḥ te ubhe nānā arthe puruṣam sinītaḥ
translated: Other is the better, and other indeed is the dear; both attract the man to different aims.

original: tayoḥ śreya ādadānasya sādhu bhavati hīyate 'rthād ya u preyo vṛṇīte // / //
analyzed: tayoḥ śreyaḥ ādadānasya sādhu bhavati hīyate rthāt yaḥ u preyaḥ vṛṇīte
translated: Of those two, it is well for him who chooses the better; he falls away from the object who chooses the dear.

original: śreyaś ca preyaś ca manuṣyam etas tau saṃparītya vivinakti dhīraḥ /
analyzed: śreyaḥ ca preyaḥ ca manuṣyam etaḥ tau saṃparītya vivinakti dhīraḥ
translated: The wise man, having considered the better and the dear, discriminates between them.

original: śreyo hi dhīro 'bhi preyaso vṛṇīte preyo mando yogakṣemād vṛṇīte // / //
analyzed: śreyaḥ hi dhīraḥ bhi preyasaḥ vṛṇīte preyaḥ mandaḥ yogakṣemāt vṛṇīte
translated: For the wise man chooses the better even above the dear; the dullard chooses the dear from the union with what is desirable.

original: sa tvaṃ priyān priyarūpāṃś ca kāmān abhidhyāyan naciketo 'tyasrākṣīḥ /
analyzed: sa tvam priyān priya rūpān ca kāmān abhidhyāyan naciketaḥ tyasrākṣīḥ
translated: But thou, O Naciketas, having meditated on the dear, the objects of desire which are dear in form, hast passed over them.

original: naitāṃ sṛṅkāṃ vittamayīm avāpto yasyāṃ majjanti bahavo manuṣyāḥ // / //
analyzed: na etām sṛṅkām vitta mayīm avāptaḥ yasyām majjanti bahavaḥ manuṣyāḥ
translated: This wealth-filled mire into which many men sink.

original: dūram ete viparīte viṣūcī avidyā yā ca vidyeti jñātā /
analyzed: dūram ete viparīte viṣūcī avidyā yā ca vidyā iti jñātā
translated: Far apart are these two, mutually opposed, ignorance and what is known as knowledge.

original: vidyābhīpsinaṃ naciketasaṃ manye na tvā kāmā bahavo 'lolupanta // / //
analyzed: vidyā abhīpsinam naciketasam manye na tvā kāmāḥ bahavaḥ lolupanta
translated: I consider Naciketas to be desirous of knowledge, not tempted by many desires.

original: avidyāyām antare vartamānāḥ svayaṃ dhīrāḥ paṇḍitaṃ manyamānāḥ /
analyzed: avidyāyām antare vartamānāḥ svayam dhīrāḥ paṇḍitam manyamānāḥ
translated: Dwelling in the midst of ignorance, considering themselves wise and learned,

original: dandramyamāṇāḥ pariyanti mūḍhā andhenaiva nīyamānā yathāndhāḥ // / //
analyzed: pariyanti mūḍhāḥ andhena eva nīyamānāḥ yathā andhāḥ
translated: The deluded ones wander about, deceived, like the blind being led by the blind.

original: na sāmparāyaḥ pratibhāti bālaṃ pramādyantaṃ vittamohena mūḍham /
analyzed: na sāmparāyaḥ pratibhāti bālam pramādyantam vitta mohena mūḍham
translated: The next world does not appear to the foolish one, who is heedless and deluded by the confusion of wealth,

original: ayaṃ loko nāsti para iti mānī punaḥ punar vaśam āpadyate me // / //
analyzed: ayam lokaḥ na asti paraḥ iti mānī punar punar vaśam āpadyate me
translated: Thinking This world exists, not the next, he repeatedly falls under my sway.

original: śravaṇāyāpi bahubhir yo na labhyaḥ śṛṇvanto 'pi bahavo yaṃ na vidyuḥ /
analyzed: śravaṇāya api bahubhiḥ yaḥ na labhyaḥ śṛṇvantaḥ pi bahavaḥ yam na vidyuḥ
translated: He who is not attained even by many who listen, whom many who listen do not know,

original: āścaryo vaktā kuśalo 'sya labdhā āścaryo jñātā kuśalānuśiṣṭaḥ // / //
analyzed: āścaryaḥ vaktā kuśalaḥ sya labdhā āścaryaḥ jñātā kuśala anuśiṣṭaḥ
translated: The wonderful teacher who has attained the skilled one, the wonderful knower who is well instructed.

original: na nareṇāvareṇa prokta eṣa suvijñeyo bahudhā cintyamānaḥ /
analyzed: na nareṇa avareṇa proktaḥ eṣa su vijñeyaḥ bahudhā cintyamānaḥ
translated: This (truth) is not easily understood by an ordinary man, when pondered in many ways,

original: ananyaprokte gatir atra nāsty aṇīyān hy atarkyam aṇupramāṇāt // / //
analyzed: an anya prokte gatiḥ atra na asti aṇīyān hi atarkyam aṇu pramāṇāt
translated: There is no progress here for one who speaks of anything else, for the subtlest thing is to be known through the subtlest means.

original: naiṣā tarkeṇa matir āpaneyā proktānyenaiva sujñānāya preṣṭha /
analyzed: nā eṣā tarkeṇa matiḥ āpaneyā proktā anyena eva su jñānāya preṣṭha
translated: This understanding is not to be attained through reasoning, O dear one, it is declared by another for the sake of good knowledge.

original: yāṃ tvam āpaḥ satyadhṛtir batāsi tvādṛṅ no bhūyān naciketaḥ preṣṭā // / //
analyzed: yām tvam āpaḥ satya dhṛtiḥ bata asi tvādṛś naḥ bhūyāt naciketaḥ
translated: You have attained it, O Naciketas, you are indeed firm in truth, may we be like you, O Naciketas, O dear one.

original: jānāmy ahaṃ śevadhir ity anityaṃ na hy adhruvaiḥ prāpyate hi dhruvaṃ tat /
analyzed: jānāmi aham śevadhiḥ iti anityam na hi adhruvaiḥ prāpyate hi dhruvam tat
translated: I know that wealth is impermanent, for the permanent is not attained by the impermanent.

original: tato mayā nāciketaś cito 'gnir anityair dravyaiḥ prāptavān asmi nityam // / //
analyzed: tatas mayā nāciketaḥ citaḥ gniḥ anityaiḥ dravyaiḥ prāptavān asmi nityam
translated: Therefore, by means of impermanent possessions, I have attained the eternal fire, Naciketas.

original: kāmasya āptiṃ jagataḥ pratiṣṭhāṃ krator anantyam abhayasya pāram /🔽stomamahad urugāyaṃ pratiṣṭhāṃ dṛṣṭvā dhṛtyā dhīro naciketo 'tyasrākṣīḥ // / //🔽taṃ durdarśaṃ gūḍham anupraviṣṭaṃ guhāhitaṃ gahvareṣṭhaṃ purāṇam /
analyzed: kāmasya āptim jagataḥ pratiṣṭhām kratoḥ anantyam abhayasya pāram  stoma mahat uru gāyam pratiṣṭhām dṛṣṭvā dhṛtyā dhīraḥ naciketaḥ tyasrākṣīḥ  tam durdarśam gūḍham anupraviṣṭam guhā hitam gahvareṣṭham purāṇam
translated: The attainment of desire, the foundation of the world, the infinity of sacrifice, the other side of fear,🔽Seeing the greatness of praise, the vastness, the foundation, the wise Naciketas, through fortitude, overcame grief and joy.🔽That God, who is difficult to see, hidden, entered into all beings, abiding in the cave, in the highest place, ancient,

original: adhyātmayogādhigamena devaṃ matvā dhīro harṣaśokau jahāti // / //
analyzed: adhyātma yoga adhigamena devam matvā dhīraḥ harṣa śokau jahāti
translated: The wise one, having known Him through the attainment of spiritual yoga, abandons grief and joy.

original: etac chrutvā saṃparigṛhya martyaḥ pravṛhya dharmyam aṇum etam āpya /
analyzed: etat śrutvā saṃparigṛhya martyaḥ pravṛhya dharmyam aṇum etam āpya
translated: Having heard this and accepted it, a mortal, having attained this subtle dharma,

original: sa modate modanīyaṃ hi labdhvā vivṛtaṃ sadma naciketasaṃ manye // / //
analyzed: sa modate modanīyam hi labdhvā vivṛtam sadma naciketasam manye
translated: He rejoices, having obtained what is to be rejoiced in. I consider Naciketas' house to be open.

original: anyatra dharmād anyatrādharmād anyatrāsmāt kṛtākṛtāt /
analyzed: anyatra dharmāt anyatra adharmāt anyatra asmāt kṛta akṛtāt
translated: Apart from Dharma, apart from Adharma, apart from this world of action and inaction,

original: anyatra bhūtāc ca bhavyāc ca yat tat paśyasi tad vada // / //
analyzed: anyatra bhūtāt ca bhavyāt ca yat tat paśyasi tat vada
translated: apart from the past and the future, whatever you see that, tell me.

original: sarve vedā yat padam āmananti tapāṃsi sarvāṇi ca yad vadanti /
analyzed: sarve vedāḥ yat padam āmananti tapāṃsi sarvāṇi ca yat vadanti
translated: All the Vedas proclaim that one state, all austerities speak of it,

original: yad icchanto brahmacaryaṃ caranti tat te padaṃ saṃgraheṇa bravīmi //
analyzed: yat icchantaḥ brahmacaryam caranti tat te padam saṃgraheṇa bravīmi
translated: and desiring which people lead the life of celibacy, that state I tell you in brief.

original: om ity etat // / //
analyzed: om iti etat
translated: Om - that is it.

original: etad dhy evākṣaraṃ brahma etad dhy evākṣaraṃ param /
analyzed: etat hi eva akṣaram brahma etat hi eva akṣaram param
translated: That is indeed the imperishable Brahman, that is indeed the supreme imperishable.

original: etad dhy evākṣaraṃ jñātvā yo yad icchati tasya tat // / //
analyzed: etat hi eva akṣaram jñātvā yaḥ yat icchati tasya tat
translated: Knowing that imperishable, whatever one desires, that is his.

original: etad ālambanaṃ śreṣṭham etad ālambanaṃ param /
analyzed: etat ālambanam śreṣṭham etat ālambanam param
translated: That is the best support, that is the supreme support.

original: etad ālambanaṃ jñātvā brahmaloke mahīyate // / //🔽na jāyate mriyate vā vipaścin nāyaṃ kutaścin na babhūva kaścit /
analyzed: etat ālambanam jñātvā brahma loke mahīyate  na jāyate mriyate vā vipaścit na ayam kutaścid na babhūva kaścid
translated: Knowing that support, one is honored in the world of Brahman.🔽The wise one is not born and does not die; this one has not come from anywhere nor has anyone gone anywhere.

original: ajo nityaḥ śāśvato 'yaṃ purāṇo na hanyate hanyamāne śarīre // / //
analyzed: ajaḥ nityaḥ śāśvataḥ yam purāṇaḥ na hanyate hanyamāne śarīre
translated: The unborn is eternal, ever-existing, permanent, and ancient; he is not killed when the body is killed.

original: hantā cen manyate hantuṃ hataś cen manyate hatam /
analyzed: hantā ced manyate hantum hataḥ ced manyate hatam
translated: If the killer thinks he is killing, and if the killed thinks he is killed,

original: ubhau tau na vijānīto nāyaṃ hanti na hanyate // / //
analyzed: ubhau tau na vijānītaḥ na ayam hanti na hanyate
translated: both of them do not know. He does not kill, nor is he killed.

original: aṇor aṇīyān mahato mahīyān ātmāsya jantor nihito guhāyām /
analyzed: aṇoḥ aṇīyān mahataḥ mahīyān ātmā asya jantoḥ nihitaḥ guhāyām
translated: Smaller than the small, greater than the great, the Self is placed in the cave of the body of this creature.

original: tam akratuḥ paśyati vītaśoko dhātuprasādān mahimānam ātmanaḥ // / //
analyzed: tam akratuḥ paśyati vīta śokaḥ dhātu prasādāt mahimānam ātmanaḥ
translated: The one without desire sees him, free from sorrow, by the purification of the elements, the greatness of the Self.

original: āsīno dūraṃ vrajati śayāno yāti sarvataḥ /
analyzed: āsīnaḥ dūram vrajati śayānaḥ yāti sarvatas
translated: Sitting, he goes far; lying down, he goes everywhere.

original: kas taṃ madāmadaṃ devaṃ mad anyo jñātum arhati // / //
analyzed: kaḥ tam madāmadam devam mat anyaḥ jñātum arhati
translated: Who else but me can know that God, who intoxicates and maddens?

original: aśarīraṃ śarīreṣu anavastheṣv avasthitam /
analyzed: aśarīram śarīreṣu anavastheṣu avasthitam
translated: The bodiless one, abiding in the unstable bodies,

original: mahāntaṃ vibhum ātmānaṃ matvā dhīro na śocati // / //
analyzed: mahāntam vibhum ātmānam matvā dhīraḥ na śocati
translated: the great, the all-pervading Self, having known this, the wise one does not grieve.

original: nāyam ātmā pravacanena labhyo na medhayā na bahunā śrutena /
analyzed: na ayam ātmā pravacanena labhyaḥ na medhayā na bahunā śrutena
translated: This Self is not attained by study, nor by wisdom, nor by much learning.

original: yam evaiṣa vṛṇute tena labhyas tasyaiṣa ātmā vivṛṇute tanūṃ svām // / //
analyzed: yam eva eṣa vṛṇute tena labhyaḥ tasya eṣaḥ ātmā vivṛṇute tanūm svām
translated: He is attained only by him whom he chooses. To him this Self reveals his own body.

original: nāvirato duścaritān nāśānto nāsamāhitaḥ /
analyzed: na a virataḥ duścaritāt na a śāntaḥ na a samāhitaḥ
translated: Not one who is not free from evil conduct, not one who is not tranquil, not one who is not concentrated,

original: nāśāntamānaso vāpi prajñānenainam āpnuyāt // / //
analyzed: na a śānta mānasaḥ vā api prajñānena enam āpnuyāt
translated: nor one whose mind is not tranquil, can attain him by mere knowledge.

original: yasya brahma ca kṣatraṃ ca ubhe bhavata odanaḥ /
analyzed: yasya brahma ca kṣatram ca ubhe bhavataḥ odanaḥ
translated: In whom both Brahman and Kshatriya become the rice,

original: mṛtyur yasyopasecanaṃ ka itthā veda yatra saḥ // / //
analyzed: mṛtyuḥ yasya upasecanam kaḥ itthā veda yatra saḥ
translated: Who here knows where he is, whose death is the sprinkling (of Soma)?

original: iti dvitīyā vallī //
analyzed: iti dvitīyā vallī
translated: Thus ends the second Valli.

original: ṛtaṃ pibantau sukṛtasya loke guhāṃ praviṣṭau parame parārdhe /
analyzed: ṛtam pibantau sukṛtasya loke guhām praviṣṭau parame parārdhe
translated: Drinking the truth in the world of good deeds, entered into the cave, in the highest, farthest end,

original: chāyātapau brahmavido vadanti pañcāgnayo ye ca triṇāciketāḥ // / //
analyzed: chāyā ātapau brahma vidaḥ vadanti pañca agnayaḥ ye ca triṇāciketāḥ
translated: The wise call them the shade and the light, those who have five fires and three Naciketas.

original: yaḥ setur ījānānām akṣaraṃ brahma yat param /
analyzed: yaḥ setuḥ ījānānām akṣaram brahma yat param
translated: He who is the bridge of those who sacrifice, the imperishable, the supreme Brahman,

original: abhayaṃ titīrṣatāṃ pāraṃ nāciketaṃ śakemahi // / //
analyzed: abhayam titīrṣatām pāram nāciketam śakemahi
translated: We may attain the Naciketas, the fearless shore for those who desire to cross over.

original: ātmānaṃ rathinaṃ viddhi śarīraṃ ratham eva tu /
analyzed: ātmānam rathinam viddhi śarīram ratham eva tu
translated: Know the self to be the rider, and the body to be the chariot itself.

original: buddhiṃ tu sārathiṃ viddhi manaḥ pragraham eva ca // / //
analyzed: buddhim tu sārathim viddhi manaḥ pragraham eva ca
translated: But know the intellect to be the charioteer, and the mind to be the reins.

original: indriyāṇi hayān āhur viṣayāṃs teṣu gocarān /
analyzed: indriyāṇi hayān āhuḥ viṣayān teṣu gocarān
translated: The senses are said to be the horses, and the objects of sense are their domain.

original: ātmendriyamanoyuktaṃ bhoktety āhur manīṣiṇaḥ // / //
analyzed: ātma indriya manaḥ yuktam bhoktā iti āhuḥ manīṣiṇaḥ
translated: The wise say that when united with the self, the senses and the mind, one is the enjoyer.

original: yas tv avijñānavān bhavaty ayuktena manasā sadā /
analyzed: yaḥ tu a vijñānavān bhavati ayuktena manasā sadā
translated: But he who is without knowledge, whose mind is always unyoked,

original: tasyendriyāṇy avaśyāni duṣṭāśvā iva sāratheḥ // / //
analyzed: tasya indriyāṇi avaśyāni duṣṭa aśvāḥ iva sāratheḥ
translated: His senses are unruly, like bad horses to a charioteer.

original: yas tu vijñānavān bhavati yuktena manasā sadā /
analyzed: yaḥ tu vijñānavān bhavati yuktena manasā sadā
translated: But he who is full of knowledge, whose mind is always well-yoked,

original: tasyendriyāṇi vaśyāni sadaśvā iva sāratheḥ // / //
analyzed: tasya indriyāṇi vaśyāni sat aśvāḥ iva sāratheḥ
translated: His senses are well-controlled, like good horses to a charioteer.

original: yas tv avijñānavān bhavaty amanaskaḥ sadāśuciḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ tu a vijñānavān bhavati amanaskaḥ sadā aśuciḥ
translated: But he who is ignorant, who is always impure, who is without mind,

original: na sa tat padam āpnoti saṃsāraṃ cādhigacchati // / //
analyzed: na sa tat padam āpnoti saṃsāram ca adhigacchati
translated: he does not attain that state, but goes to transmigration.

original: yas tu vijñānavān bhavati samanaskaḥ sadā śuciḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ tu vijñānavān bhavati samanaskaḥ sadā śuciḥ
translated: But he who is wise, who is always pure, who has mind,

original: sa tu tat padam āpnoti yasmād bhūyo na jāyate // / //
analyzed: sa tu tat padam āpnoti yasmāt bhūyas na jāyate
translated: he attains that state, from which there is no rebirth.

original: vijñānasārathir yas tu manaḥ pragrahavān naraḥ /
analyzed: vijñāna sārathiḥ yaḥ tu manaḥ pragrahavān naraḥ
translated: He who has wisdom as his charioteer, who has control over the mind,

original: so 'dhvanaḥ pāram āpnoti tad viṣṇoḥ paramaṃ padam // / //
analyzed: saḥ dhvanaḥ pāram āpnoti tat viṣṇoḥ paramam padam
translated: he reaches the other end of the path, that is Vishnu's supreme abode.

original: indriyebhyaḥ parā hy arthā arthebhyaś ca paraṃ manaḥ /
analyzed: indriyebhyaḥ parāḥ hi arthāḥ arthebhyaḥ ca param manaḥ
translated: The objects are superior to the senses, and the mind is superior to the objects.

original: manasas tu parā buddhir buddher ātmā mahān paraḥ // / //🔽mahataḥ param avyaktam avyaktāt puruṣaḥ paraḥ /
analyzed: manasaḥ tu parā buddhiḥ buddheḥ ātmā mahān paraḥ  mahataḥ param avyaktam avyaktāt puruṣaḥ paraḥ
translated: But the intellect is superior to the mind, and the great Self is superior to the intellect.🔽The unmanifest is superior to the great, and the Purusha is superior to the unmanifest.

original: puruśān na paraṃ kiṃcit sā kāṣṭhā sā parā gatiḥ // / //
analyzed: puruśās na param kiṃcid sā kāṣṭhā sā parā gatiḥ
translated: There is nothing superior to the Purusha, that is the ultimate, that is the supreme goal.

original: eṣa sarveṣu bhūteṣu gūḍho 'tmā na prakāśate /
analyzed: eṣa sarveṣu bhūteṣu gūḍhaḥ ā ātmā na prakāśate
translated: That Self, hidden in all beings, does not manifest.

original: dṛṣyate tv agryayā buddhyā sūkṣmayā sūkṣmadarśibhiḥ // / //
analyzed: dṛṣyate tu agryayā buddhyā sūkṣmayā sūkṣma darśibhiḥ
translated: But it is seen by those who see the subtle, by means of the most excellent intellect.

original: yacched vāṅmanasī prājñas tad yacchej jñāna ātmani /
analyzed: yacchet vāc manasī prājñaḥ tat yacchet jñāne ātmani
translated: The wise one should restrain speech and mind, and that [restraint] he should place in the Self, which is knowledge.

original: jñānam ātmani mahati niyacchet tad yacchec chānta ātmani // / //
analyzed: jñānam ātmani mahati niyacchet tat yacchet śānte ātmani
translated: One should restrain the knowledge in the great Self, and that one should restrain in the tranquil Self.

original: uttiṣṭhata jāgrata prāpya varān nibodhata /
analyzed: uttiṣṭhata jāgrata prāpya varān nibodhata
translated: Rise up, be vigilant, and having attained the excellent boons, understand them.

original: kṣurasya dhārā niśitā duratyayā durgaṃ pathas tat kavayo vadanti // / //
analyzed: kṣurasya dhārā niśitā duratyayā durgam pathaḥ tat kavayaḥ vadanti
translated: The edge of a razor is sharp, hard to pass over, that path is difficult, say the wise.

original: aśabdam asparśam arūpam avyayaṃ tathārasaṃ nityam agandhavac ca yat /
analyzed: a śabdam a sparśam a rūpam avyayam tathā arasam nityam a gandhavat ca yat
translated: That which is soundless, touchable, formless, imperishable, tasteless, eternal, and odorless,

original: anādy anantaṃ mahataḥ paraṃ dhruvaṃ nicāyya tan mṛtyumukhāt pramucyate // / //
analyzed: anādi anantam mahataḥ param dhruvam nicāyya tat mṛtyu mukhāt pramucyate
translated: Without beginning, without end, beyond the great, firm, having realized that, one is freed from the jaws of death.

original: nāciketam upākhyānaṃ mṛtyuproktaṃ sanātanam /
analyzed: nāciketam upākhyānam mṛtyu proktam sanātanam
translated: The ancient story of Naciketas, spoken by Death,

original: uktvā śrutvā ca medhāvī brahmaloke mahīyate // / //
analyzed: uktvā śrutvā ca medhāvī brahma loke mahīyate
translated: Having spoken and listened to it, the wise one is honored in the world of Brahman.

original: ya imaṃ paramaṃ guhyaṃ śrāvayed brahmasaṃsadi /
analyzed: yaḥ imam paramam guhyam śrāvayet brahma saṃsadi
translated: He who would proclaim this supreme secret in an assembly of Brahmins,

original: prayataḥ śrāddhakāle vā tad ānantyāya kalpate /
analyzed: prayataḥ śrāddha kāle vā tat ānantyāya kalpate
translated: Or being restrained at the time of a funeral ceremony, that is considered for his endlessness.

original: tad ānantyāya kalpata iti // / //
analyzed: tat ānantyāya kalpate iti
translated: That is considered for his endlessness.

original: iti tṛtīyā vallī //
analyzed: iti tṛtīyā vallī
translated: Thus ends the third Valli.

original: parāñci khāni vyatṛṇat svayaṃbhūs tasmāt parāṅ paśyati nāntarātman /
analyzed: parāñci khāni vyatṛṇat svayaṃbhūḥ tasmāt parāṅ paśyati na antarātman
translated: The Self-Existent One has cut out the external openings, therefore one sees externally, not within the inner self.

original: kaścid dhīraḥ pratyag ātmānam aikṣad āvṛttacakṣur amṛtatvam icchan // / //
analyzed: kaścid dhīraḥ pratyak ātmānam aikṣat āvṛtta cakṣuḥ amṛta tvam icchan
translated: Some wise one, with eyes turned inward, desiring immortality, has seen the Self within.

original: parācaḥ kāmān anuyanti bālās te mṛtyor yanti vitatasya pāśam /
analyzed: parācaḥ kāmān anuyanti bālāḥ te mṛtyoḥ yanti vitatasya pāśam
translated: Fools pursue desires that lead them to the far shore, into the noose of death.

original: atha dhīrā amṛtatvaṃ viditvā dhruvam adhruveṣv iha na prārthayante // / //
analyzed: atha dhīrāḥ amṛta tvam viditvā dhruvam adhruveṣu iha na prārthayante
translated: But the wise, knowing immortality, do not seek the permanent among the impermanent here.

original: yena rūpaṃ rasaṃ gandhaṃ śabdān sparśīṃś ca maithunān /
analyzed: yena rūpam rasam gandham śabdān sparśīn ca maithunān
translated: By which one knows form, taste, smell, sounds, and tactile objects, and sexual pleasures,

original: etenaiva vijānāti kim atra pariśiṣyate //
analyzed: etena eva vijānāti kim atra pariśiṣyate
translated: By that alone one knows, what remains here?

original: etad vai tat // / //
analyzed: etat vai tat
translated: This indeed is that...

original: svapnāntaṃ jāgaritāntaṃ cobhau yenānupaśyati /
analyzed: svapna antam jāgarita antam ca ubhau yena anupaśyati
translated: By which one sees in a dream and in the waking state, both of them,

original: mahāntaṃ vibhum ātmānaṃ matvā dhīro na śocati // / //
analyzed: mahāntam vibhum ātmānam matvā dhīraḥ na śocati
translated: The wise one, considering the great, all-pervading Self, does not grieve.

original: ya imaṃ madhvadaṃ veda ātmānaṃ jīvam antikāt /
analyzed: yaḥ imam madhvadam veda ātmānam jīvam antikāt
translated: One who knows this sweet-flavored Self, the living one, from near,

original: īśānaṃ bhūtabhavyasya na tato vijugupsate //
analyzed: īśānam bhūta bhavyasya na tatas vijugupsate
translated: The lord of the past and the future, does not despise it.

original: etad vai tat // / //
analyzed: etat vai tat
translated: This indeed is that...

original: yaḥ pūrvaṃ tapaso jātam adbhyaḥ pūrvam ajāyata /
analyzed: yaḥ pūrvam tapasaḥ jātam adbhyaḥ pūrvam ajāyata
translated: He who was born before austerity, who was born before water,

original: guhāṃ praviśya tiṣṭhantaṃ yo bhūtebhir vyapaśyata //
analyzed: guhām praviśya tiṣṭhantam yaḥ bhūtebhiḥ vyapaśyata
translated: Who, entering the cave, was seen by the beings,

original: etad vai tat // / //
analyzed: etat vai tat
translated: This indeed is that...

original: yā prāṇena saṃbhavati aditir devatāmayī /
analyzed: yā prāṇena saṃbhavati aditiḥ devatā mayī
translated: She who is born with the vital breath, Aditi, full of deities,

original: guhāṃ praviśya tiṣṭhantīṃ yā bhūtebhir vyajāyata //
analyzed: guhām praviśya tiṣṭhantīm yā bhūtebhiḥ vyajāyata
translated: Who, entering the cave, was born by the beings.

original: etad vai tat // / //
analyzed: etat vai tat
translated: This indeed is that...

original: araṇyor nihito jātavedā garbha iva subhṛto garbhiṇībhiḥ /
analyzed: araṇyoḥ nihitaḥ jātavedāḥ garbhaḥ iva su bhṛtaḥ garbhiṇībhiḥ
translated: Jatavedas, placed in the kindling sticks, like a well-protected embryo by the pregnant women,

original: divediva īḍyo jāgṛvadbhir haviṣmadbhir manuṣyebhir agniḥ //
analyzed: dive dive īḍyaḥ jāgṛvadbhiḥ haviṣmadbhiḥ manuṣyebhiḥ agniḥ
translated: Agni, who is to be worshipped day by day by the watchful and offering men.

original: etad vai tat // / //
analyzed: etat vai tat
translated: This indeed is that...

original: yataś codeti sūryo astaṃ yatra ca gacchati /
analyzed: yatas ca udeti sūryaḥ astam yatra ca gacchati
translated: From which the sun rises and to which it goes to set,

original: taṃ devāḥ sarve arpitās tad u nātyeti kaścana //
analyzed: tam devāḥ sarve arpitāḥ tat u na atyeti kaścana
translated: In which all the gods are contained, none goes beyond that.

original: etad vai tat // / //
analyzed: etat vai tat
translated: This indeed is that...

original: yad eveha tad amutra yad amutra tad anv iha /
analyzed: yat eva iha tat amutra yat amutra tat anu iha
translated: What is here, that is there; what is there, that is here.

original: mṛtyoḥ sa mṛtyum āpnoti ya iha nāneva paśyati // / //
analyzed: mṛtyoḥ sa mṛtyum āpnoti yaḥ iha nānā iva paśyati
translated: He who sees difference here, goes from death to death.

original: manasaivedam āptavyaṃ neha nānāsti kiṃcana /
analyzed: manasā eva idam āptavyam na iha nānā asti kiṃcana
translated: This should be attained by the mind alone; there is no diversity here at all.

original: mṛtyoḥ sa mṛtyuṃ gacchati ya iha nāneva paśyati // / //
analyzed: mṛtyoḥ sa mṛtyum gacchati yaḥ iha nānā iva paśyati
translated: He who sees diversity here, goes from death to death.

original: aṅguṣṭhamātraḥ puruṣo madhya ātmani tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: aṅguṣṭha mātraḥ puruṣaḥ madhye ātmani tiṣṭhati
translated: The person who is the size of a thumb, stands in the middle of the self.

original: īśāno bhūtabhavyasya na tato vijugupsate //
analyzed: īśānaḥ bhūta bhavyasya na tatas vijugupsate
translated: The lord of the past and the future, from him he is not disgusted.

original: etad vai tat // / //
analyzed: etat vai tat
translated: This indeed is that...

original: aṅguṣṭhamātraḥ puruṣo jyotir iva adhūmakaḥ /
analyzed: aṅguṣṭha mātraḥ puruṣaḥ jyotiḥ iva adhūmakaḥ
translated: The person who is the size of a thumb, like a smokeless light,

original: īśāno bhūtabhavyasya sa evādya sa u śvaḥ //
analyzed: īśānaḥ bhūta bhavyasya saḥ eva adya saḥ u śvas
translated: He is the Lord of the past and the future, He is today, and He is tomorrow.

original: etad vai tat // / //
analyzed: etat vai tat
translated: This indeed is that...

original: yathodakaṃ durge vṛṣṭaṃ parvateṣu vidhāvati /
analyzed: yathā udakam durge vṛṣṭam parvateṣu vidhāvati
translated: Just as water falling on a mountain flows down the slopes,

original: evaṃ dharmān pṛthak paśyaṃs tān evānu vidhāvati // / //
analyzed: evam dharmān pṛthak paśyan tān eva anu vidhāvati
translated: so one who sees dharmas separately follows them accordingly...

original: yathodakaṃ śuddhe śuddham āsiktaṃ tādṛg eva bhavati /
analyzed: yathā udakam śuddhe śuddham āsiktam tādṛś eva bhavati
translated: Just as pure water poured into pure water becomes the same,

original: evaṃ muner vijānata ātmā bhavati gautama // / //
analyzed: evam muneḥ vijānataḥ ātmā bhavati gautama
translated: so the sage's self becomes, O Gautama, when he knows...

original: iti caturthī vallī //
analyzed: iti caturthī vallī
translated: Thus ends the fourth Valli.

original: puram ekādaśadvāram ajasyāvakracetasaḥ /
analyzed: puram ekādaśa dvāram ajasya a vakra cetasaḥ
translated: The city with eleven gates of the unborn one with an unbent mind,

original: anuṣṭhāya na śocati vimuktaś ca vimucyate //
analyzed: anuṣṭhāya na śocati vimuktaḥ ca vimucyate
translated: having performed, he does not grieve, and being liberated, he is liberated.

original: etad vai tat // / //🔽haṃsaḥ śuciṣad vasur antarikṣasad dhotā vediṣad atithir duroṇasat /
analyzed: etat vai tat  haṃsaḥ śuci sad vasuḥ antarikṣa sad hotā vedi sad atithiḥ duroṇa sad
translated: This indeed is that...🔽The swan sitting in the pure, the good sitting in the atmosphere, the priest sitting on the altar, the guest sitting in the house,

original: nṛṣad varasad ṛtasad vyomasad abjā gojā ṛtajā adrijā ṛtaṃ bṛhat // / //
analyzed: nṛṣad vara sad ṛta sad vyoma sad ap jāḥ go jāḥ ṛta jāḥ adri jāḥ ṛtam bṛhat
translated: sitting among men, sitting in the best, sitting in truth, sitting in the sky, born from water, born from cows, born from truth, born from mountains, the great truth...

original: ūrdhvaṃ prāṇam unnayati apānaṃ pratyag asyati /
analyzed: ūrdhvam prāṇam unnayati apānam pratyak asyati
translated: He carries the upward-moving breath upwards, and the downward-moving breath he sends back.

original: madhye vāmanam āsīnaṃ viśve devā upāsate // / //🔽asya visraṃsamānasya śarīrasthasya dehinaḥ /
analyzed: madhye vāmanam āsīnam viśve devāḥ upāsate  asya visraṃsamānasya śarīra sthasya dehinaḥ
translated: The Viśvedevas attend upon the dwarf seated in the middle...🔽Of this embodied one, dwelling in the body, when it is being loosened,

original: dehād vimucyamānasya kim atra pariśiṣyate //
analyzed: dehāt vimucyamānasya kim atra pariśiṣyate
translated: when it is being released from the body, what remains here?

original: etad vai tat // / //
analyzed: etat vai tat
translated: This, verily, is that.

original: na prāṇena nāpānena martyo jīvati kaścana /
analyzed: na prāṇena na apānena martyaḥ jīvati kaścana
translated: No mortal lives by the out-breath or the in-breath,

original: itareṇa tu jīvanti yasminn etāv upāśritau // / //
analyzed: itareṇa tu jīvanti yasmin etau upāśritau
translated: but by that other one on which these two depend.

original: hanta ta idaṃ pravakṣyāmi guhyaṃ brahma sanātanam /
analyzed: hanta te idam pravakṣyāmi guhyam brahma sanātanam
translated: I will now declare to you that secret, the eternal Brahman,

original: yathā ca maraṇaṃ prāpya ātmā bhavati gautama // / //
analyzed: yathā ca maraṇam prāpya ātmā bhavati gautama
translated: and how the Self becomes so, O Gautama, after attaining death.

original: yonim anye prapadyante śarīratvāya dehinaḥ /
analyzed: yonim anye prapadyante śarīra tvāya dehinaḥ
translated: Some embodied beings enter another womb for the sake of a body,

original: sthāṇum anye 'nusaṃyanti yathākarma yathāśrutam // / //
analyzed: sthāṇum anye nusaṃyanti yathākarma yathāśrutam
translated: while others go to a tree, according to their deeds and what they have heard.

original: ya eṣa supteṣu jāgarti kāmaṃ kāmaṃ puruṣo nirmimāṇaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ eṣa supteṣu jāgarti kāmam kāmam puruṣaḥ nirmimāṇaḥ
translated: He who, while all are asleep, awakens, creating desire after desire,

original: tad eva śukraṃ tad brahma tad evāmṛtam ucyate /
analyzed: tat eva śukram tat brahma tat eva amṛtam ucyate
translated: that is the semen, that is Brahman, that is called the immortal.

original: tasmiṃl lokāḥ śritāḥ sarve tad u nātyeti kaścana //
analyzed: tasmin lokāḥ śritāḥ sarve tat u na atyeti kaścana
translated: All worlds rest on that, none goes beyond it.

original: etad vai tat // / //
analyzed: etat vai tat
translated: This, verily, is that.

original: agnir yathaiko bhuvanaṃ praviṣṭo rūpaṃ rūpaṃ pratirūpo babhūva /
analyzed: agniḥ yathā ekaḥ bhuvanam praviṣṭaḥ rūpam rūpam pratirūpaḥ babhūva
translated: Just as fire, though one, having entered the worlds, becomes manifold in form,

original: ekas tathā sarvabhūtāntarātmā rūpaṃ rūpaṃ pratirūpo bahiś ca // / //
analyzed: ekaḥ tathā sarva bhūta antarātmā rūpam rūpam pratirūpaḥ bahis ca
translated: so also the one Self of all beings, though one, is manifold in form outside.

original: vāyur yathaiko bhuvanaṃ praviṣṭo rūpaṃ rūpaṃ pratirūpo babhūva /
analyzed: vāyuḥ yathā ekaḥ bhuvanam praviṣṭaḥ rūpam rūpam pratirūpaḥ babhūva
translated: Just as air, though one, having entered the worlds, becomes manifold in form,

original: ekas tathā sarvabhūtāntarātmā rūpaṃ rūpaṃ pratirūpo bahiś ca // / //
analyzed: ekaḥ tathā sarva bhūta antarātmā rūpam rūpam pratirūpaḥ bahis ca
translated: And one, the inner soul of all beings, assumes different forms in each individual body.

original: sūryo yathā sarvalokasya cakṣur na lipyate cākṣuṣair bāhyadoṣaiḥ /
analyzed: sūryaḥ yathā sarva lokasya cakṣuḥ na lipyate cākṣuṣaiḥ bāhya doṣaiḥ
translated: Just as the sun is the eye of the entire world, yet is not affected by external defects of the eyes,

original: ekas tathā sarvabhūtāntarātmā na lipyate lokaduḥkhena bāhyaḥ // / //
analyzed: ekaḥ tathā sarva bhūta antarātmā na lipyate loka duḥkhena bāhyaḥ
translated: In the same way, the one inner soul of all beings is not affected by the sufferings of the world, being external to it.

original: eko vaśī sarvabhūtāntarātmā ekaṃ rūpaṃ bahudhā yaḥ karoti /
analyzed: ekaḥ vaśī sarva bhūta antarātmā ekam rūpam bahudhā yaḥ karoti
translated: The one, the self-controlled, the inner soul of all beings, who creates the one form in many ways,

original: tam ātmasthaṃ ye 'nupaśyanti dhīrās teṣāṃ sukhaṃ śāśvataṃ netareṣām // / //
analyzed: tam ātma stham ye nupaśyanti dhīrāḥ teṣām sukham śāśvatam na itareṣām
translated: Those wise ones who see Him as abiding in the Self, for them there is eternal bliss, not for others.

original: nityo 'nityānāṃ cetanaś cetanānām eko bahūnāṃ yo vidadhāti kāmān /
analyzed: nityaḥ nityānām cetanaḥ cetanānām ekaḥ bahūnām yaḥ vidadhāti kāmān
translated: The eternal one among the non-eternal, the conscious one among the conscious, the one who grants the desires of the many,

original: tam ātmasthaṃ ye 'nupaśyanti dhīrās teṣaṃ śāntiḥ śāśvatī netareṣām // / //
analyzed: tam ātma stham ye nupaśyanti dhīrāḥ teṣam śāntiḥ śāśvatī na itareṣām
translated: Those wise ones who see Him as abiding in the Self, for them there is eternal peace, not for others.

original: tad etad iti manyante 'nirdeśyaṃ paramaṃ sukham /
analyzed: tat etat iti manyante nirdeśyam paramam sukham
translated: They consider that to be the indescribable supreme bliss.

original: kathaṃ nu tad vijānīyāṃ kim u bhāti vibhāti vā // / //
analyzed: katham nu tat vijānīyām kim u bhāti vibhāti vā
translated: How can I know that? What shines or illuminates?

original: na tatra sūryo bhāti na candratārakaṃ nemā vidyuto bhānti kuto 'yam agniḥ /
analyzed: na tatra sūryaḥ bhāti na candra tārakam na imāḥ vidyutaḥ bhānti kutas yam agniḥ
translated: There the sun does not shine, nor the moon and stars, nor these lightnings, much less this fire,

original: tam eva bhāntam anu bhāti sarvaṃ tasya bhāsā sarvam idaṃ vibhāti // / //
analyzed: tam eva anu bhāti sarvam tasya bhāsā sarvam idam vibhāti
translated: On him, shining, everything shines. By his light all this shines.

original: iti pañcamī vallī //
analyzed: iti pañcamī vallī
translated: Thus ends the fifth Valli.

original: ūrdhvamūlo avākśākha eṣo 'śvatthaḥ sanātanaḥ /
analyzed: ūrdhva mūlaḥ avāc śākhaḥ eṣaḥ u śvatthaḥ sanātanaḥ
translated: This is the eternal Ashvattha tree, with its root above and branches below.

original: tad eva śukraṃ tad brahma tad evāmṛtam ucyate /
analyzed: tat eva śukram tat brahma tat eva amṛtam ucyate
translated: That is the pure, that is Brahman, that is said to be the immortal.

original: tasmiṃl lokāḥ śritāḥ sarve tad u nātyeti kaścana //
analyzed: tasmin lokāḥ śritāḥ sarve tat u na atyeti kaścana
translated: In that all worlds are established, none goes beyond it.

original: etad vai tat // / //🔽yad idaṃ kiṃca jagat sarvaṃ prāṇa ejati niḥsṛtam /
analyzed: etat vai tat  yat idam kiṃca jagat sarvam prāṇaḥ ejati niḥsṛtam
translated: This indeed is that...🔽Whatever moves in this world, all that moves out of the vital breath.

original: mahad bhayaṃ vajram udyataṃ ya etad vidur amṛtās te bhavanti // / //
analyzed: mahat bhayam vajram udyatam ye etat viduḥ amṛtāḥ te bhavanti
translated: Those who know this, they become immortal...

original: bhayād asyāgnis tapati bhayāt tapati sūryaḥ /
analyzed: bhayāt asya agniḥ tapati bhayāt tapati sūryaḥ
translated: Out of fear of this, Agni burns, out of fear the sun burns.

original: bhayād indraś ca vāyuś ca mṛtyur dhāvati pañcamaḥ // / //
analyzed: bhayāt indraḥ ca vāyuḥ ca mṛtyuḥ dhāvati pañcamaḥ
translated: Out of fear, Indra and Vayu, death runs as the fifth...

original: iha ced aśakad boddhuṃ prākśarīrasya visrasaḥ /
analyzed: iha ced aśakat boddhum prāk śarīrasya visrasaḥ
translated: If one is unable to understand this even here, before the body decays,

original: tataḥ sargeṣu lokeṣu śarīratvāya kalpate // / //
analyzed: tatas sargeṣu lokeṣu śarīra tvāya kalpate
translated: Then in the creations and worlds, one is fit for the state of a body...

original: yathādarśe tathātmani yathā svapne tathā pitṛloke /
analyzed: yathā ādarśe tathā ātmani yathā svapne tathā pitṛ loke
translated: As in a mirror, so in the self; as in a dream, so in the world of the ancestors.

original: yathāpsu parīva dadṛśe tathā gandharvaloke chāyātapayor iva brahmaloke // / //
analyzed: yathā apsu pari iva dadṛśe tathā gandharva loke chāyā ātapayoḥ iva brahma loke
translated: As if seen in water, so in the world of the Gandharvas; like shadow and light, in the world of Brahman...🔽...

original: indriyāṇāṃ pṛthagbhāvam udayāstamayau ca yat /
analyzed: indriyāṇām pṛthagbhāvam udaya astamayau ca yat
translated: The wise one, considering the individual nature of the senses, their rising and setting,

original: pṛthag utpadyamānānāṃ matvā dhīro na śocati // / //🔽indriyebhyaḥ paraṃ mano manasaḥ sattvam uttamam /
analyzed: pṛthak utpadyamānānām matvā dhīraḥ na śocati  indriyebhyaḥ param manaḥ manasaḥ sattvam uttamam
translated: and their arising separately, does not grieve.🔽The mind is superior to the senses; the life-force is superior to the mind.

original: sattvād adhi mahānātmā mahato 'vyaktam uttamam // / //
analyzed: sattvāt adhi mahān ātmā mahataḥ vyaktam uttamam
translated: Beyond the life-force is the great self; the unmanifest is superior to the great self.

original: avyaktāt tu paraḥ puruṣo vyāpako 'liṅga eva ca /
analyzed: avyaktāt tu paraḥ puruṣaḥ vyāpakaḥ liṅgaḥ eva ca
translated: But beyond the unmanifest is the Purusha, the all-pervading, the one without distinguishing marks.

original: yaṃ jñātvā mucyate jantur amṛtatvaṃ ca gacchati // / //
analyzed: yam jñātvā mucyate jantuḥ amṛta tvam ca gacchati
translated: Knowing Him, a creature is liberated and attains immortality.

original: na saṃdṛśe tiṣṭhati rūpam asya na cakṣuṣā paśyati kaścanainam /
analyzed: na saṃdṛśe tiṣṭhati rūpam asya na cakṣuṣā paśyati kaścana enam
translated: His form does not stand within the range of vision; no one sees Him with the eye.

original: hṛdā manīṣā manasābhikḷpto ya etad vidur amṛtās te bhavanti // / //
analyzed: hṛdā manīṣā manasā abhikḷptaḥ ye etat viduḥ amṛtāḥ te bhavanti
translated: He is conceived by the mind, formed by the thought in the heart. Those who know Him become immortal.

original: yadā pañcāvatiṣṭhante jñānāni manasā saha /
analyzed: yadā pañca avatiṣṭhante jñānāni manasā saha
translated: When the five senses along with the mind cease to function,

original: buddhiś ca na viceṣṭati tām āhuḥ paramāṃ gatim // / //
analyzed: buddhiḥ ca na viceṣṭati tām āhuḥ paramām gatim
translated: and the intellect does not stir, they call that the supreme goal.

original: tāṃ yogam iti manyante sthirām indriyadhāraṇām /
analyzed: tām yogam iti manyante sthirām indriya dhāraṇām
translated: They consider that to be Yoga, the firm control of the senses.

original: apramattas tadā bhavati yogo hi prabhavāpyayau // / //
analyzed: apramattaḥ tadā bhavati yogaḥ hi prabhava apyayau
translated: Then one becomes heedful, for Yoga is the origin and end of both.

original: naiva vācā na manasā prāptuṃ śakyo na cakṣuṣā /
analyzed: na eva vācā na manasā prāptum śakyaḥ na cakṣuṣā
translated: He cannot be attained by speech or mind, nor can He be seen with the eye.

original: astīti bruvato 'nyatra kathaṃ tad upalabhyate // / //
analyzed: asti iti bruvataḥ nyatra katham tat upalabhyate
translated: How can that be perceived elsewhere by one who says 'it exists'?

original: astīty evopalabdhavyas tattvabhāvena cobhayoḥ /
analyzed: asti iti evā upalabdhavyaḥ tattva bhāvena ca ubhayoḥ
translated: One should perceive only as 'existing' the true nature of both.

original: astīty evopalabdhasya tattvabhāvaḥ prasīdati // / //
analyzed: asti iti eva upalabdhasya tattva bhāvaḥ prasīdati
translated: For one who perceives only as 'existing', the true nature becomes clear.

original: yadā sarve pramucyante kāmā ye 'sya hṛdi śritāḥ /
analyzed: yadā sarve pramucyante kāmāḥ ye sya hṛdi śritāḥ
translated: When all the desires that are lodged in the heart are completely released,

original: atha martyo 'mṛto bhavaty atra brahma samaśnute // / //
analyzed: atha martyaḥ mṛtaḥ bhavati atra brahma samaśnute
translated: then a mortal becomes immortal; here one attains Brahman.

original: yadā sarve prabhidyante hṛdayasyeha granthayaḥ /
analyzed: yadā sarve prabhidyante hṛdayasya iha granthayaḥ
translated: When all the knots of the heart are completely broken here,

original: atha martyo 'mṛto bhavaty etāvad dhy anuśāsanam // / //
analyzed: atha martyaḥ mṛtaḥ bhavati etāvat hi anuśāsanam
translated: then a mortal becomes immortal; this is the instruction.

original: śataṃ caikā ca hṛdayasya nāḍyas tāsāṃ mūrdhānam abhiniḥsṛtaikā /
analyzed: śatam ca ekā ca hṛdayasya nāḍyaḥ tāsām mūrdhānam abhiniḥsṛtā ekā
translated: There are one hundred and one channels of the heart; of them, one goes out through the top of the head.

original: tayordhvam āyann amṛtatvam eti viṣvaṅṅ anyā utkramaṇe bhavati // / //
analyzed: tayā ūrdhvam āyan amṛta tvam eti viṣvaṅ anyā utkramaṇe bhavati
translated: Going upwards through that, one attains immortality; the other goes in all directions at the time of departing.

original: aṅguṣṭhamātraḥ puruṣo 'ntarātmā sadā janānāṃ hṛdaye saṃniviṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: aṅguṣṭha mātraḥ puruṣaḥ ntarātmā sadā janānām hṛdaye saṃniviṣṭaḥ
translated: The person of the size of a thumb, the inner self, always dwells in the heart of people.

original: taṃ svāc charīrāt pravṛhen muñjād iveṣīkāṃ dhairyeṇa /
analyzed: tam svāt śarīrāt pravṛhet muñjāt iva iṣīkām dhairyeṇa
translated: One should extract him from one's own body with firmness, like a reed from a muñja grass.

original: taṃ vidyāc chukram amṛtaṃ taṃ vidyāc chukram amṛtam iti // / //
analyzed: tam vidyāt śukram amṛtam tam vidyāt śukram amṛtam iti
translated: One should know that as the pure, immortal essence; one should know that as the pure, immortal essence.

original: mṛtyuproktāṃ naciketo 'tha labdhvā vidyām etāṃ yogavidhiṃ ca kṛtsnam /
analyzed: mṛtyu proktām labdhvā vidyām etām yoga vidhim ca kṛtsnam
translated: Then Naciketas, having obtained this knowledge and the whole yoga method, as declared by Death,

original: brahmaprāpto virajo 'bhūd vimṛtyur anyo 'py evaṃ yo vid adhyātmam eva // / //🔽iti ṣaṣṭhī vallī //
analyzed: brahma prāptaḥ virajaḥ bhūt vimṛtyuḥ evam yaḥ vid adhyātmam eva  iti ṣaṣṭhī vallī
translated: attained Brahman, became free from passion, and immortal. Another who knows this very self in the soul...🔽Thus ends the sixth Valli.

original: iti kaṭhopaniṣat //
analyzed: iti kaṭhopaniṣad
translated: Thus ends the Katha Upanishad.
